intro: Aconitum × paniculatum subsp. degenii, commonly known as the Degen's monkshood, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet, hood-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with dark green, doubly serrated leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value is highly appreciated in gardens, though it is toxic and should be handled with care.
